title: Drawing, "Virgin and child with Saints.", First half 17th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over sanguine traces on laid paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, Smithsonian Institution (Lugt 457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The Virgin sits with Child behind her, standing on a pedestal upon steps.  Beside the group are two angels one of them carrying a cardinal's hat.  Beside the pedestal stand at left a bishop with a book and crozier, at right St. Cecilia.  In front of the pedestal are St. John the Baptist standing, St. Jerome sitting and visiting St. Thomas Aquinas kneeling in the background, above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Virgin and child with Saints.", First half 17th century.
First half 17th century. Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over sanguine traces on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1565.
